macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Rally Pushes Dow Above 49,000 Record; S&P 500 and Nasdaq Also Hit New Highs
items.summary: US stocks rallied on Tuesday with the Dow Jones up 0.99% to close above 49,000 for the first time, S&P 500 gaining 0.62% to a record, and Nasdaq up 0.65%, driven by easing geopolitical tensions after the US capture of Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro. US 10-year Treasury yields edged up to 4.169% ahead of key labor data that could influence Fed rate cut expectations.[1]

items.title: Indian Sensex and Nifty Decline Amid Mixed Sector Performance; IT and Pharma Outperform
items.summary: BSE Sensex fell 0.44% to 85,063.34 and NSE Nifty50 dropped 0.27% to 26,178.70 on Tuesday, with broader midcap and smallcap indices also lower, while IT, pharma, PSU banks, and metals gained. Markets expected to trade range-bound on Wednesday, with Nifty support at 26,000-25,900 and Bank Nifty eyeing upside above 60,437.[2]

items.title: US Stock Futures Point to Mixed Open on Wednesday
items.summary: US stock index futures indicated a mixed open early Wednesday, with Dow E-minis down 0.17% and S&P 500 E-minis down slightly at 5:36 a.m. ET, following Tuesday's rally.[3]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Dips Amid Profit-Taking After Strong Early 2026 Rally
items.summary: Bitcoin fell 1.4% to $92,660 while altcoins experienced steeper losses, with Cardano down 3.2%, Zcash down 2.8%, and Stellar down 4.7%. The decline follows a 7-8% Bitcoin rally from late December as traders locked in gains after the market's sharp rebound.

items.title: XRP Emerges as Breakout Trade of 2026, Surges Over 20% Weekly
items.summary: XRP has become the hottest cryptocurrency trade of early 2026, surging more than 20% this year and climbing to the third-largest cryptocurrency by market value. The payments-focused token is attracting significant institutional interest as traders view it as a less crowded alternative to Bitcoin.

items.title: MSCI Maintains MicroStrategy Inclusion, Removes Near-Term Downside Risk
items.summary: MSCI confirmed it will maintain the inclusion of DATSS constituents, including MicroStrategy, deferring any removal decision to the 2026 review. The news lifted MSTR shares approximately 5-6% in after-hours trading and helped stabilize institutional expectations.

items.title: Walmart Launches Bitcoin and Ethereum Trading via OnePay Platform
items.summary: Walmart has launched BTC and ETH trading through its OnePay service, enabling customers to convert cryptocurrency to retail spending. This represents a significant expansion of crypto adoption in mainstream retail.

items.title: Morgan Stanley Files for Bitcoin and Solana Spot ETF Products
items.summary: Morgan Stanley submitted filings to the SEC for Bitcoin and Solana-related products, targeting the spot ETF and trust segment. This signals continued institutional interest in cryptocurrency investment vehicles.

items.title: U.S. Senate Advances Crypto Market Structure Legislation
items.summary: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee is reportedly scheduling review and votes on crypto market structure legislation as early as next week, signaling regulatory progress in the sector.

items.title: South Korea Implements Stricter Crypto Enforcement Standards
items.summary: South Korea is evaluating a preventive freeze and trading suspension regime for crypto exchanges, with enforcement standards potentially aligned more closely with equity markets. The country also plans to impose fines of up to 10% of losses on hacked exchanges.

items.title: Tether Introduces New Accounting Unit 'Scudo' for Tether Gold
items.summary: Tether has introduced a new accounting unit called 'Scudo' for Tether Gold (XAU₮) to streamline transactions and improve operational efficiency.

items.title: Japan Implements OECD Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework
items.summary: Japan has implemented the OECD Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework (CARF), advancing international regulatory standards for cryptocurrency reporting and compliance.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA Announces Physical AI Model for Robotaxis at CES 2026
items.summary: NVIDIA unveiled a new physical AI model for robotaxis and strengthened its partnership with Siemens during CES 2026. CEO Jensen Huang highlighted the company's new generation of AI processors now in full production.

items.title: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang Outlines AI Innovations and Future Roadmap at CES
items.summary: At CES 2026 in Las Vegas, NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang detailed advances in AI chips, autonomous driving software, and the next generation of processors entering full production.

items.title: Rise of Agentic AI Transforming Enterprise Networks
items.summary: Agentic AI is evolving enterprise networks into autonomous, self-optimizing systems that proactively resolve issues using machine learning and GenAI, moving beyond reactive management.

items.title: Generative AI Rapidly Adopted in Software Engineering Workflows
items.summary: New research shows widespread use of GenAI tools in software engineering for implementation, testing, and maintenance, reducing development time and improving code quality despite challenges like reliability.

items.title: Texas A&M Launches SSPAIN.ai Tool for Predictive Sports Sponsorship Analytics
items.summary: Texas A&M researchers developed SSPAIN.ai, an AI tool using machine learning on over 5,800 sponsorships to forecast renewals and durations, attracting interest from NFL, Dallas Mavericks, and others.

items.title: LSU Highlights Next-Gen AI for Smarter Security and Energy Efficiency
items.summary: LSU research predicts continued AI scaling with transformers, growth in AI security, and advances in neuromorphic computing and TinyML for resource-constrained environments.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds Multiple Surprise Titles on January 7 Including Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass launched several surprise games today including Little Nightmares: Enhanced Edition, Atomfall, Lost in Random: The Eternal Die, Rematch, and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine – Master Crafted Edition, all available via Game Pass Premium on various platforms.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass January 2026 Lineup Expanded with Star Wars Outlaws and Resident Evil Village
items.summary: Microsoft announced more Game Pass additions for January: Final Fantasy on January 8, Star Wars Outlaws on January 13, My Little Pony: A Zephyr Heights Mystery and Mio: Memories in Orbit on January 15 and 20, and Resident Evil Village on January 20.

items.title: NVIDIA Launches G-SYNC Pulsar Monitors with Ambient Adaptive Tech Starting January 7
items.summary: NVIDIA introduced G-SYNC Pulsar technology in new monitors from Acer, AOC, ASUS, and MSI, available from January 7 at 6AM PT, offering enhanced motion clarity up to 1040Hz effective rate; also announced 63 new G-SYNC Compatible displays.

items.title: VR Studio Cloudhead Games Lays Off 70% of Workforce
items.summary: Pistol Whip developer Cloudhead Games announced it will cut 70% of its staff on January 7, 2026, as shared by CEO Denny Unger.

items.title: AMD Unveils Ryzen 7 9850X3D Gaming Processor at CES 2026
items.summary: AMD showcased its latest gaming-focused CPU, the Ryzen 7 9850X3D, during Day 1 of CES 2026, alongside other chip announcements from Nvidia and Intel.

items.title: Razer Reveals AI-Powered Gaming Headset and Desk Companion Prototypes at CES 2026
items.summary: Razer demonstrated Project Motoko (AI over-ear gaming headset) and an updated holographic Project Ava desk companion at CES Day 2, both AI-agnostic and expected for commercial release later in 2026.

items.title: Games Workshop Announces Warhammer Preview Show for January 16
items.summary: Games Workshop scheduled a preview show on January 16 at 7:30PM GMT with new announcements for Age of Sigmar, Blood Bowl, Horus Heresy, and Warhammer 40,000.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Intel Launches Core Ultra Series 3 Processors at CES 2026
items.summary: Intel unveiled its Core Ultra Series 3 chips featuring up to 15% better performance per watt and 30% better chip density. The new processors support up to 180 TOPS with 120 GPU TOPS and 96GB DDR5x memory for local and cloud AI capabilities.

items.title: Qualcomm Announces Snapdragon X2 Plus Chip at CES 2026
items.summary: Qualcomm revealed the Snapdragon X2 Plus, a more affordable version of its next-generation laptop chipset, following the high-performance Snapdragon X2 Elite. The chips continue Qualcomm's push into the laptop market with improved battery life and performance.

items.title: AMD Announces Ryzen 7 9850X3D and Additional Chips at CES 2026
items.summary: AMD unveiled multiple new processors at CES 2026, including the Ryzen 7 9850X3D, positioning the company competitively against Intel's latest offerings.

items.title: HP Introduces EliteBoard G1a: PC-Integrated Keyboard
items.summary: HP unveiled the EliteBoard G1a, a 12mm-thick keyboard that integrates a Copilot+ PC with an AMD Ryzen AI 300 series chip, built-in speakers, dual mics, and a user-replaceable 35Wh battery.

items.title: Samsung Unveils Micro RGB 130-Inch TV and New Display Technologies
items.summary: Samsung announced its 2026 TV lineup featuring an industry-first 130-inch Micro RGB display, alongside OLED and mini LED options. The company emphasized next-generation display technology and premium picture quality.

items.title: Dolby Vision 2 Support Confirmed for Hisense, TCL, and Philips TVs
items.summary: Hisense, TCL, and Philips announced support for Dolby Vision 2, the next version of the HDR format, with select models launching this year.

items.title: LG Showcases 6K Mac-Compatible Monitors and OLED Gaming Displays
items.summary: LG previewed new 6K monitors optimized for Mac systems and high-speed OLED gaming displays at CES 2026, featuring advanced brightness and performance improvements.

items.title: Asus Releases Updated Zenbook DUO at CES 2026
items.summary: Asus unveiled an updated version of its dual-screen Zenbook DUO laptop at CES 2026.
